snippet: So much is silly and reductive in the way we turn sports stars, including Andrew Luck and Peyton Manning, into characters in fate-driven morality plays.
abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column criticizes the way in which fans turn sports stars, including quarterbacks Andrew Luck of Indianapolis Colts and Peyton Manning of Denver Broncos, into characters in fate-driven morality plays; admits, however, that Luck-Manning duel made for an oddly entertaining start to this latest pro football season.
lead_paragraph: So much is silly and reductive in the way we turn sports stars, including Andrew Luck and Peyton Manning, into characters in fate-driven morality plays.

headline.seo: Peyton Manning and Andrew Luck Plagued by Reductionism
headline.main: A New Season of Typecasting for N.F.L. Quarterbacks
headline.print_headline: A New Season of Typecasting for N.F.L. Quarterbacks
